basics.name: Emmanuel PAYET
basics.label: Software Engineer, searching for a challenging job in London
basics.summary:
I'm an experimented software engineer specialized in web technologies. I did 3 years of apprenticeship as part of my dual education (one week in a company, one week at school) combined with long internships. I have finished my studies in Bordeaux (France) and just landed in London. I am actively searching a challenging job to develop my technical skills.

Until recently, I was a software engineer in the R&D team of Cdiscount, e-commerce leader in France. I led several internal projects as well as the developer hub (API documentation and app management) of the Cdiscount openAPI. I was in charge of every step of these projects (conception, development, operations, maintenance). 
In an every-day basis, I did research on new technologies and often organized workshops (e.g. coding dojos). I was also in charge of training a junior developer. My technical and communication skills were greatly improved.

Colleagues know me as a rigorous and enthusiast programmer who can always be trusted to come up with a new approach. I use as much as possible agile methodologies (like Extreme Programming) in my work and personal projects. Productivity is fundamental to me, and I set my toolbox in consequence (continuous delivery, version control, fitting IDE, etc.). I'm capable of handling every step of a project, but I also work well in a team.

At work, I gained experience in JavaScript, Java and Linux system. During my free time, I study new technologies on many subjects (web and mobile technologies, docker, microservices, video game development, raspberry pi, etc.). All of this makes me someone who tries to find the most effective solutions to computing problems.

work.summary:
Created the developer hub (API documentation and app management) of the Cdiscount openAPI with public access. 
Developed several internal projects in web technologies (single-page applications, RESTful servers, NoSQL databases). 
Assured the correct implementation of agile methodologies, testing (TDD, integration tests, UI tests, etc.), automation (continuous integration and delivery, docker), and other good development practices (code review, pair programming, constant refactoring, etc.).
Started migration to microservices.
Active technological monitoring and organization of knowledge sharing workshops (e.g. coding dojos).
Trained a junior developer.

Technologies: OO JavaScript (ES6), AngularJS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Java, Kafka, Docker, Jenkins, git, linux, bower, gulp, karma, jasmine, protractor

Sonar integration in the continuous integration process (Jenkins)
Worked on the core architecture of the project BidRight (Java)
Created a RESTful API (Java / Jersey)
Created a scraping web app (Python / Django)

Developed in the web services team on different projects
Created an internal application of web service monitoring (SOAP / REST) to ease management and use of web services on different environments (production, dev, etc.), which improved the team productivity.

Languages : C#, SQL Server, Silverlight

Developed a Google Map module for Dynmap (cartography software)
Languages: PHP/MySQL, JavaScript/AJAX

education.institution: EPSI (École Privée des Sciences Informatiques) - Computer Science Engineering Top School
Trois Mares High School, Reunion Island
